9. Encourages support for Security Sector Reform (SSR) as crucial for long-term stability.

10. Calls on Guinea-Bissau authorities to combat transnational organized crime, particularly drug trafficking and money laundering.

11. Encourages international cooperation to enhance Guinea-Bissau's control of air traffic and maritime security.

12. Requests the Special Representative to improve coherence and coordination among UN agencies to combat drug trafficking.

13. Invites the Special Representative to share information with the Committee established by resolution 2048 (2012).

14. Stresses the challenges posed by drug trafficking and requests the Secretary-General to provide anti-drug expertise within UNIOGBIS.

15. Encourages international partners to support Guinea-Bissau in tackling transnational organized crime.

16. Emphasizes the importance of an international pledging conference on Guinea-Bissau's recovery.

17. Requests the Secretary-General to submit regular reports on the implementation of this resolution.

18. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
